content.question: A block is moving horizontally with a speed of <math alttext="v sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>v</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> when it encounters a ramp, as shown above. Which of the following graphs best represents the position of the block measured from the top of the ramp as a function of time if friction is negligible?

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of a line in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled Time, and the vertical axis is labeled Position. The line begins high above the horizontal axis, just to the right of the vertical axis. It moves downward and to the right until it ends on the horizontal axis, far to the right of the vertical axis.

The figure presents the graph of a line in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled Time, and the vertical axis is labeled Position. The line at the origin. It moves upward and to the right until it ends at a point far above the horizontal axis and far to the right of the vertical axis.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled Time, and the vertical axis is labeled Position. The line at the origin. It moves gradually upward and to the right initially. As time increases, the curve moves more steeply upward and to the right, until it ends at a point far above the horizontal axis and far to the right of the vertical axis.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled Time, and the vertical axis is labeled Position. The line at the origin. It moves steadily upward and to the right initially. As time increases, the curve begins to level off at a point far above the horizontal axis. It continues almost horizontally to the right, until it ends at a point far above the horizontal axis and far to the right of the vertical axis.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph of a curve in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled Time, and the vertical axis is labeled Position. The line at the origin. It moves gradually upward and to the right initially. As time increases, the curve moves more steeply upward and to the right, until it ends at a point far above the horizontal axis and far to the right of the vertical axis.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
